qas.question: Who established the FEELS model in China?

answers.text: Flexible-goals, Engaged-learner, Embodied-knowledge, Learning-through-interactions, and Supportive-teacher

qas.question: What is the purpose of the FEELS model?

answers.text: It is used for understanding and evaluating educational curriculum under the assumption that the purpose of education is to "help a person become whole."

qas.question: What entities are working together to promote the FEELS model?

answers.text: Chinese government organizations and the Institute for the Postmodern Development of China

qas.question: Who established the HEELS model in China?

plausible_answers.text: Flexible-goals, Engaged-learner, Embodied-knowledge, Learning-through-interactions, and Supportive-teacher
Chinese government organizations and the Institute for the Postmodern Development of China

qas.question: What entities are working together to promote the HEELS model?

context: Another model is the FEELS model developed by <a0_0><b4_0>Xie Bangxiu<b4_0/><a0_0/> and deployed successfully in China. "FEELS" stands for five things in curriculum and education: <a1_0><b5_0>Flexible-goals, Engaged-learner, Embodied-knowledge, Learning-through-interactions, and Supportive-teacher<b5_0/><a1_0/>. <a2_0>It is used for understanding and evaluating educational curriculum under the assumption that the purpose of education is to "help a person become whole."<a2_0/> This work is in part the product of cooperation between <a3_0><b6_0>Chinese government organizations and the Institute for the Postmodern Development of China<b6_0/><a3_0/>.
